FacilityName: SOUTHERN FS, INC - MULKEYTOWN NH3 SITE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
                                                         MULKEYTOWN   NH3 - SITE

1.    FACILITY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY.

      THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOUTHERN FS, INC  ARE COMMITTED TO 
      THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTIAL
      RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPT.,
      OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE 
      TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMWENT.

2.   THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.

      THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY,  WICH IS LOCATED AT 1763 STATE HIGHWAY 14   MULKEYTOWN, IL,  IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECTAPPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT.  THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSIST OF 2 STORAGE TANKS (44,000 GALLONS), LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.

       THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 350,000
       POUNDS, THIS INCLUDES ANHYDROUS AMMONIA  THAT COULD BE STORED IN NURSE TANKS. 


3.   THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

      THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL
      APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE 
      PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS
      AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AS 
      ADOPTED BY STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY
      AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111,  "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF 
      ANHYDROUS AMMONIA". COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REG

ULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OUR     EMPLOYEES MAKE UP OUR ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

4.   THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT:
      - HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATHS, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY; NOR
      - TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATION, SHELTER IN PLACE
        PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.
      

5.   THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

      THE FACILITY HAS ...  A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA 
      STANDARD, 29  1910.38;

      PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-
      TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III  (EPCRA);

      IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA , IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY
      THE CHRISTOPHER FIRE DEPARTMENT AND FRANKLIN COUNTY LEPC.

6.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

      SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE
      PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THER ARE NO SPECIFIC SAFETY
      RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
